resources.string: Waiting for Briar to scan QR code…
The Mailbox helps you to stay in touch with your contacts and synchronizes your messages to Briar.
Install the Mailbox app on a spare phone or tablet and leave it connected to power and WiFi.
When your Mailbox is online, your contacts can leave messages for you even if your Briar is offline. The Mailbox will receive the messages, and forward them to Briar when you come online.
Messages going through the Mailbox are encrypted and cannot be read by the Mailbox or this phone. The Mailbox simply forwards them to your Briar Messenger phone.
Briar Mailbox was unable to run in the background
Scan this QR code with Briar
Copy this and paste it into Briar Desktop:
Check your time, timezone, and date in system settings. After fixing, wait some time for Tor to recover.
Please ensure this device is online and connected to the Internet. Once you\'re online, setup should pick up automatically here.
If you unlink your Mailbox, you won\'t be able to receive messages while Briar is offline.\n\nAre you sure you want to unlink your Mailbox?

When you stop your Mailbox, the app will shut down and it will stop receiving messages until you open the app again.\n\nAny messages that have already been received will be saved. Briar will be able to collect them when you reopen the Mailbox app.
Your Mailbox has been successfully linked with Briar.\n\nKeep your Mailbox connected to power and Wi-Fi so it\'s always online.
Next time you have access to your Briar device, please open the Mailbox settings screen in the Briar app, then tap the \"Unlink\" button to complete the process.
No app found for this action
Mailbox was unable to start a required component.\n\nPlease upgrade to the latest version of the app and try again.
Mailbox has already stopped.\n\nPlease close the app and try again.
